rooms.description: Wheelchair accessible entry with wide doors and smooth transitions, aligned to North-facing entrance. Incorporates local Kerala stone tiles and wooden accents.
Spacious living area with traditional Kerala motifs, natural ventilation with large windows facing North for positive energy flow.
Adjacent to the living room, with open-plan layout and built-in Kerala-style seating arrangements. Wheelchair accessible.
Functional kitchen designed with local materials ensuring proper ventilation and water drainage, integrating modern appliances while preserving traditional aesthetics.
Traditional Kerala room design with ample space, equipped with a spacious balcony for natural light and privacy. Wheelchair accessible layout.

openings.description: North-facing entrance designed to harness positive energy per Vastu Shastra, featuring a ramp for wheelchair access and large glass doors.
Each bedroom features a balcony with traditional stone railings and wooden flooring, ensuring privacy while offering views of the garden or pool area.
Designated access route to an adjoining swimming pool area with a gentle slope, ensuring wheelchair accessibility and safety.

additional_features.description: All areas, including the living room, kitchen, bedrooms, and common spaces are designed with ramps, wide doorways (minimum 2.5m width), and level thresholds.
House is planned on a corner plot to maximize natural light exposure and ventilation across the building, aligning with local architectural norms.
The design embraces the traditional open courtyard concept prevalent in Kerala architecture for communal living while integrating modern amenities.
